firstsOfNepal.perfectScore: Perfect! You know your Nepali history well!
firstsOfNepal.goodScore: Good job! You know quite a bit about Nepal's history.
firstsOfNepal.keepLearning: Keep learning! You'll get better with practice.

bhimsenThapa.name: Bhimsen Thapa
bhimsenThapa.description: Served as the first Prime Minister of Nepal, also known as Mukhtiyar, and implemented various administrative reforms.

ramBaranYadav.name: Ram Baran Yadav
ramBaranYadav.description: Became the first President of Nepal after the country was declared a federal democratic republic.

sushilaKarki.name: Sushila Karki
sushilaKarki.description: First female Chief Justice of Nepal's Supreme Court.

bidhanLama.name: Bidhan Lama
bidhanLama.description: First Nepali to win an Olympic medal (Bronze) in Taekwondo demonstration event.

tenzingNorgay.name: Tenzing Norgay
tenzingNorgay.description: First person (along with Edmund Hillary) to reach the summit of Mount Everest.

pasangLhamuSherpa.name: Pasang Lhamu Sherpa
pasangLhamuSherpa.description: First Nepali woman to successfully climb Mount Everest.

buddhaKrishnaBam.name: Buddha Krishna Bam
buddhaKrishnaBam.description: First Nepali to be nominated for a Nobel Prize in Physics.

baikunthaManandhar.name: Baikuntha Manandhar
baikunthaManandhar.description: First Nepali footballer to play professionally in an international league.

dwarikaDeviThakurani.name: Dwarika Devi Thakurani
dwarikaDeviThakurani.description: First female minister in Nepal's cabinet.

lainSinghBangdel.name: Lain Singh Bangdel
lainSinghBangdel.description: First internationally recognized modern artist from Nepal.

hiraSinghKhatri.name: Hira Singh Khatri
hiraSinghKhatri.description: Directed the first Nepali feature film 'Aama'.

yankilaSherpa.name: Yankila Sherpa
yankilaSherpa.description: First female entrepreneur to establish a major tourism company in Nepal.

padamSundarMalla.name: Padma Sundar Malla
padamSundarMalla.description: Padma Sundar Malla was the first electrical engineer of Nepal. He pursued his studies in engineering abroad during the early 20th century and played a pioneering role in introducing modern electrical technology to Nepal.

harishchandra.name: Harishchandra
harishchandra.description: First Nepali-language movie, produced in India and released in 1951, marking the beginning of Nepali cinema.

sirishGurung.name: Sirish Gurung
sirishGurung.description: First Nepali to compete in Olympic swimming.

sandukRuit.name: Sanduk Ruit
sandukRuit.description: First Nepali doctor to develop revolutionary cataract surgery technique.

bilamLalShrestha.name: Bilam Lal Shrestha
bilamLalShrestha.description: First Nepali chess player to achieve international master status.

prekshyaLama.name: Prekshya Lama
prekshyaLama.description: First female police officer in Nepal.

minBahadurPoudel.name: Min Bahadur Poudel
minBahadurPoudel.description: First Nepali scientist to publish research in Nature journal.

sitaTamang.name: Sita Tamang
sitaTamang.description: First Nepali woman to compete in an international marathon.

arjunBhandari.name: Arjun Bhandari
arjunBhandari.description: First Nepali to contribute to a NASA-funded space research project.

buddhiMayaSubedi.name: Buddhi Maya Subedi
buddhiMayaSubedi.description: First female pilot to fly a commercial airline in Nepal.

pratimaPoudel.name: Pratima Poudel
pratimaPoudel.description: First Nepali woman to become a civil engineer.

gangaPrasadTiwari.name: Ganga Prasad Tiwari
gangaPrasadTiwari.description: First Nepali to become a professional commercial pilot.

nishaAdhikari.name: Nisha Adhikari
nishaAdhikari.description: First Nepali woman to direct a commercially successful film.

rohitJohnChhetri.name: Rohit John Chhetri
rohitJohnChhetri.description: First Nepali TV anchor to host a nationally recognized prime-time show.

sanjitaPandey.name: Sanjita Pandey
sanjitaPandey.description: First Nepali woman to conduct groundbreaking research in the field of genetics.

sudeepSharma.name: Sudeep Sharma
sudeepSharma.description: First Nepali photographer to exhibit internationally and gain global recognition.

biraGun.name: Bira Gun
biraGun.description: First gun manufactured in Nepal, known for its historical significance and craftsmanship.

narayanGopal.name: Narayan Gopal
narayanGopal.description: First Nepali singer to gain international fame for his classical and modern compositions.

binodChaudhary.name: Binod Chaudhary
binodChaudhary.description: First Nepali to become a billionaire and founder of the Chaudhary Group.

padamSundarMalla2.category: Person to visit the United States
padamSundarMalla2.name: Padma Sundar Malla
padamSundarMalla2.description: Padma Sundar Malla was the first Nepali to visit the United States for higher education.

bishweshwarPrasadKoirala.name: Bishweshwar Prasad Koirala
bishweshwarPrasadKoirala.description: First Nepali Prime Minister from the democratic movement and led Nepal in a pivotal era of political transformation.

madanKrishnaShrestha.name: Madan Krishna Shrestha
madanKrishnaShrestha.description: First Nepali actor and comedian to use comedy for social activism and awareness.

nischalPoudel.name: Nischal Poudel
nischalPoudel.description: First Nepali to launch a successful e-commerce platform recognized internationally.

mayaSherpa.name: Maya Sherpa
mayaSherpa.description: First Nepali woman to work as a mountain guide in the Himalayas.

laxmiPrasadDevkota.name: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
laxmiPrasadDevkota.description: First Nepali poet to be widely recognized for his contributions to Nepali literature and national identity.

sumanBTamang.name: Suman B. Tamang
sumanBTamang.description: First Nepali to work with a space research institute abroad and contribute to a space project.

ramaSingh.name: Rama Singh
ramaSingh.description: First female captain to lead Nepal's women's football Bagmati team, Singh began her journey in 1983. At the 1986 Asian Cup, she captained Nepal in its international debut.

puspaBhandari.name: Puspa Bhandari
puspaBhandari.description: First Nepali to win a world championship title in the sport of weightlifting.

rohitRajPoudel.name: Rohit Raj Poudel
rohitRajPoudel.description: First Nepali to win an international chess tournament at the grandmaster level.

nandaLalPoudel.name: Nanda Lal Poudel
nandaLalPoudel.description: First Nepali woman to represent Nepal in international boxing competitions.

amitBhandari.name: Amit Bhandari
amitBhandari.description: First Nepali to compete in the International Mountain Biking Championship.

rohitKumar.name: Rohit Kumar
rohitKumar.description: First Nepali sports journalist to cover international events for a leading sports network.

puspaRajChhetri.name: Puspa Raj Chhetri
puspaRajChhetri.description: First Nepali to direct a national television series.

sitaSahi.name: Sita Sahi
sitaSahi.description: First Nepali to lead a national environmental organization focusing on wildlife protection and habitat conservation.

shreehariSharma.name: Dr. Shreehari Sharma
shreehariSharma.description: First Nepali scientist to specialize in climate modeling and its impact on the Himalayan ecosystem.

deepaShrestha.name: Deepa Shrestha
deepaShrestha.description: First Nepali woman wildlife photographer to receive international recognition for her work.

parijat.name: Parijat
parijat.description: First female Nepali novelist to gain widespread recognition for her literary works.

sumanAdhikari.name: Suman Adhikari
sumanAdhikari.description: First Nepali to establish an NGO focusing on human rights and political freedom.

anilShrestha.name: Anil Shrestha
anilShrestha.description: First Nepali to lead a cybersecurity initiative for a multinational tech company.

ritaBhandari.name: Rita Bhandari
ritaBhandari.description: First Nepali woman selected as a candidate for a civilian space mission.

sureshPokharel.name: Suresh Pokharel
sureshPokharel.description: First Nepali to publish a peer-reviewed paper on artificial intelligence in an international journal.

krishnaBahadurThapa.name: Krishna Bahadur Thapa
krishnaBahadurThapa.description: First Nepali to compete in the Paralympic Games, participating in wheelchair racing.

rubinaChhetri.name: Rubina Chhetri
rubinaChhetri.description: First Nepali woman to captain the national women's cricket team in an international match.

kiranBhattarai.name: Kiran Bhattarai
kiranBhattarai.description: First Nepali to win an international award for a documentary on Himalayan biodiversity.

prabinLama.name: Prabin Lama
prabinLama.description: First Nepali to design a robot showcased at an international robotics expo.

anitaShrestha.name: Anita Shrestha
anitaShrestha.description: First Nepali woman to perform a successful open-heart surgery.

hariRoka.name: Hari Roka
hariRoka.description: First Nepali to win a major international marathon in Asia.

kamalaShrestha.name: Kamala Shrestha
kamalaShrestha.description: First Nepali woman to work as a war correspondent during regional conflicts.

dineshAdhikari.name: Dinesh Adhikari
dineshAdhikari.description: First Nepali to contribute to a breakthrough in quantum computing research.

saritaMaskey.name: Sarita Maskey
saritaMaskey.description: First Nepali woman to design a nationally recognized public building.

lilaGurung.name: Lila Gurung
lilaGurung.description: First Nepali woman to host a radio program broadcast nationwide.

monikaThapa.name: Monika Thapa
monikaThapa.description: First Nepali woman to achieve the title of Woman International Master in chess.

bikashPandey.name: Bikash Pandey
bikashPandey.description: First Nepali to implement a large-scale micro-hydropower project for rural electrification.

anjaliTamang.name: Anjali Tamang
anjaliTamang.description: First Nepali woman to win a national marathon championship.

dawaYangzumSherpa.name: Dawa Yangzum Sherpa
dawaYangzumSherpa.description: First Nepali woman certified as an international mountaineering guide.

aama.name: Aama
aama.description: The first film produced in Nepal, directed by Hira Singh Khatri and made by the Nepalese government, released on October 7, 1964.

maitighar.name: Maitighar
maitighar.description: The first Nepali film produced under a private banner by Sumonanjali Films Pvt. Ltd., featuring Mala Sinha and Indian contributions.

kumari.name: Kumari
kumari.description: The first Nepali film produced in color, directed by Prem Bahadur Basnet under the Royal Nepal Film Corporation.

legendOfShankhadhar.name: The Legend of Shankhadhar
legendOfShankhadhar.description: The first animated Nepali film, a biopic on Shankhadhar Shakhwa, who started the Nepal Sambat era in 879 AD.

bijuliMachine.name: Bijuli Machine
bijuliMachine.description: The first Nepali science fiction film with a social narrative, directed by Navin Awal, addressing power cuts in society.

motiramBhatta.name: Motiram Bhatta
motiramBhatta.description: The first poet in Nepali literature, known for his contributions to the development of the language.

bhanubhaktaAcharya.name: Bhanubhakta Acharya
bhanubhaktaAcharya.description: The first poet to write in Nepali, known for translating the Ramayana, earning him the title 'Adikavi' (First Poet).

gorkhapatra.name: Gorkhapatra
gorkhapatra.description: The first Nepali-language newspaper, published under the Rana regime, marking the start of print media in Nepal.

tribhuvanUniversity.name: Tribhuvan University
tribhuvanUniversity.description: The first university in Nepal, established to provide higher education and research opportunities.

pharpingHydropowerStation.name: Pharping Hydropower Station
pharpingHydropowerStation.description: The first hydroelectric power station in Nepal, generating 500 kW, commissioned during the Rana period.

nepalTelevision.name: Nepal Television
nepalTelevision.description: The first television broadcast in Nepal, launched on January 31, 1985, under state control.

royalNepalAirlines.name: Royal Nepal Airlines
royalNepalAirlines.description: The first international flight by Nepal's national carrier, connecting Kathmandu to Patna, India.

divyaUpadesh.name: Prithvi Narayan Shah's Divya Upadesh
divyaUpadesh.description: The first book printed in Nepali, a collection of teachings by the founder of modern Nepal.

karnaliRiverBridge.name: Karnali River Bridge (Chisapani)
karnaliRiverBridge.description: The first major suspension bridge in Nepal, spanning the Karnali River, improving connectivity in the far west.

tribhuvanAirport.name: Tribhuvan Airport
tribhuvanAirport.description: The first airport in Nepal, originally called Gauchar Airport, now known as Tribhuvan International Airport.

nepalPrajaParishad.name: Nepal Praja Parishad
nepalPrajaParishad.description: The first political party in Nepal, founded to oppose the Rana regime and advocate for democracy.

governmentOfNepalAct.name: Government of Nepal Act
governmentOfNepalAct.description: The first written constitution of Nepal, introduced by Padma Shumsher Rana, though largely symbolic under Rana rule.

generalElection1959.name: General Election
generalElection1959.description: The first democratic election in Nepal, held under King Mahendra, won by the Nepali Congress.

radioNepal.name: Radio Nepal
radioNepal.description: The first radio station in Nepal, launched on April 2, 1951, after the fall of the Rana regime.

pashupatiStamp.name: Nepal Pashupati Stamp
pashupatiStamp.description: The first postage stamp issued in Nepal, featuring the Pashupatinath Temple, during the Rana period.

shrimanGambhir.name: Shriman Gambhir
shrimanGambhir.description: The first national anthem of Nepal, used until 2006, composed during the Rana era.

chitwanNationalPark.name: Chitwan National Park
chitwanNationalPark.description: The first national park in Nepal, established to protect wildlife, including the Bengal tiger and one-horned rhinoceros.

mercantileCommunications.name: Mercantile Communications
mercantileCommunications.description: The first internet service provider in Nepal, introducing email and dial-up connectivity.

nepaliSat1.name: NepaliSat-1
nepaliSat1.description: The first Nepali satellite, a CubeSat, launched into space with assistance from Japan, for research purposes.

nepalVsMCC.name: Nepal vs. MCC
nepalVsMCC.description: The first international cricket match played by Nepal, against the Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC).

birHospital.name: Bir Hospital
birHospital.description: The first modern hospital in Nepal, established by Bir Shumsher Rana, offering public healthcare.

durbarHighSchool.name: Durbar High School
durbarHighSchool.description: The first formal school in Nepal, initially for Rana children, later opened to the public.

kaiserLibrary.name: Kaiser Library
kaiserLibrary.description: The first public library in Nepal, established by Kaiser Shumsher Rana with a vast collection of books.

nationalMuseum.name: National Museum of Nepal
nationalMuseum.description: The first museum in Nepal, opened in Kathmandu to preserve art, history, and culture.

nepalBankLimited.name: Nepal Bank Limited
nepalBankLimited.description: The first commercial bank in Nepal, established to modernize financial services.

kathmanduValleyUnesco.name: Kathmandu Valley
kathmanduValleyUnesco.description: The first Nepali site listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, recognizing its cultural significance.
